security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and instructions for git commit workflow. No executable code, scripts, or network activity. The skill uses standard git operations through Claude Code tools which are controlled by the user.

content.user_title: Create git commits with conventional messages
content.value_statement: Creating meaningful git commits helps track project history and enables automated changelog generation. This skill analyzes staged changes and generates conventional commit messages automatically.
actual_capabilities: Analyze staged and unstaged git changes
Generate conventional commit messages (type: scope: description)
Identify change types (feat, fix, docs, style, refactor, test, chore)
Enforce commit message best practices (imperative mood, character limits)
Verify commit success and report hash
limitations: Cannot commit without user confirmation in interactive mode
Does not create branches or handle merge conflicts
Does not push to remote repositories
Does not modify existing commit history (no force push)

use_cases.title: Automate commit messages
use_cases.description: Quickly create properly formatted commit messages for any staged changes without remembering conventional commit rules.

use_cases.title: Enforce commit standards
use_cases.description: Ensure all team commits follow conventional commits format for automated changelog generation and release notes.

use_cases.title: Standardize version history
use_cases.description: Generate consistent commit history that works with semantic versioning tools and automated release pipelines.

prompt_templates.title: Specific type

prompt_templates.title: With scope

prompt_templates.title: Full specification

best_practices: Review the generated commit message before allowing the commit to execute
Use specific scopes that match your project structure
Verify staged changes match your intended commit content
anti_patterns: Using the skill for sensitive files containing passwords or API keys
Requesting force pushes on shared branches
Skipping the commit message review step

faq.question: What are conventional commits?
faq.answer: Standardized format using type(scope): description. Types include feat, fix, docs, style, refactor, test, and chore.

faq.question: Can I edit the generated message?
faq.answer: Yes. Pass a custom message parameter to override the auto-generated commit message.

faq.question: Does this push to remote?
faq.answer: No. This skill only creates local commits. Push separately after reviewing changes.

faq.question: Is this safe for sensitive code?
faq.answer: The skill runs git commands locally. Review staged files before committing to avoid exposing secrets.

faq.question: What tools does this support?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code through their standard git and file access capabilities.

faq.question: How is this different from git add -a && git commit -m?
faq.answer: This skill analyzes changes and generates meaningful messages following industry conventions automatically.
